citadels

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • citadels.core.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the main game logic and state management for a session of Citadels. Handles setup, character selection, and progression of rounds.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Game.Phase
      Represents the current phase of the game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor that starts a new game and prompts user for number of players.
      Game(java.util.List<DistrictCard> districtCardTemplates, int numPlayers)
      Alternate constructor for testing or scripted game setup.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(java.util.List<DistrictCard> districtCardTemplates)
        Constructor that starts a new game and prompts user for number of players.
        Parameters:
        districtCardTemplates - Templates used to build the district card districtDeck

      • Game

        public Game(java.util.List<DistrictCard> districtCardTemplates,
            int numPlayers)
        Alternate constructor for testing or scripted game setup.
        Parameters:
        districtCardTemplates - District cards to use
        numPlayers - Number of players

    • Method Detail

      • startCharacterSelectionPhase

        public void startCharacterSelectionPhase()
        Handles entire character selection phase, including discards and player picks. Ensures King is not discarded face-up and triggers Throne Room if crown changes.

      • markCharacterKilled

        public void markCharacterKilled(int killChoice)
        Marks a character as killed based on the selected character number.
        Parameters:
        killChoice - The character turn number that was targeted by the Assassin.

      • startTurnPhase

        public void startTurnPhase()
        Begins the main turn phase of the round where each character acts in order. Players will take their actions or be skipped depending on which character they chose.

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public Player getCurrentPlayer()
        Returns the player whose turn is currently active.
        Returns:
        The current player, or null if invalid index or no players exist

      • checkEndCondition

        public void checkEndCondition()
        Checks if any player has completed their city and triggers end-game if so. Completion threshold is 7 if Bell Tower is active, otherwise 8.

      • getFinalRoundNumber

        public int getFinalRoundNumber()
        Returns the final round number when the game is set to end.
        Returns:
        The round number the game ends on

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
        Returns the list of all players in the game.
        Returns:
        List of Player objects

      • getDeck

        public Deck getDeck()
        Returns the district districtDeck used in the game.
        Returns:
        The Deck instance

      • getDiscardedCharacterCardsFaceUp

        public java.util.List<CharacterCard> getDiscardedCharacterCardsFaceUp()
        Gets the list of face-up discarded character cards for the current round.
        Returns:
        List of discarded character cards (face-up)

      • getCharacterDeck

        public CharacterDeck getCharacterDeck()
        Gets the current districtDeck of character cards.
        Returns:
        The CharacterDeck instance

      • getCurrentRound

        public int getCurrentRound()
        Gets the number of the current round.
        Returns:
        Current round number

      • getCityForPlayer

        public java.util.List<DistrictCard> getCityForPlayer(Player player)
        Returns the list of districts built by a specific player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player whose city to return
        Returns:
        List of DistrictCard objects representing their built city

      • addDistrictToCity

        public void addDistrictToCity(Player player,
                              DistrictCard district)
        Adds a district to the specified player's city.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to add the district to
        district - The district card being added

      • isBellTowerActive

        public boolean isBellTowerActive()
        Returns whether the Bell Tower is currently active.
        Returns:
        true if the Bell Tower was activated, false otherwise

      • activateBellTower

        public void activateBellTower()
        Activates the Bell Tower effect, which makes the game end after 7 districts instead of 8.

      • deactivateBellTower

        public void deactivateBellTower()
        Deactivates the Bell Tower if it is active, restoring the default end condition.

      • getPlayerByCharacterNumber

        public Player getPlayerByCharacterNumber(int characterNumber)
        Returns the player who selected the character with the given number.
        Parameters:
        characterNumber - The turn order number of the character
        Returns:
        The player who picked that character, or null if no one did

      • getPlayerByNumber

        public Player getPlayerByNumber(int targetPlayerNum)
        Gets the player at the given player number (1-indexed).
        Parameters:
        targetPlayerNum - The number of the player (starting from 1)
        Returns:
        The Player object, or null if the number is invalid

      • getCharacterAbilityInfo

        public java.lang.String getCharacterAbilityInfo(Player player)
        Returns the chosen character's name and ability for the given player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player whose character info is requested
        Returns:
        A string with the character name and ability, or a fallback if none is chosen

      • calculateScores

        public java.util.Map<Player,PlayerScore> calculateScores()
        Calculates and returns the scores for all players at the end of the game.
        Returns:
        A map of players to their corresponding PlayerScore objects

      • determineWinner

        public Player determineWinner(java.util.Map<Player,PlayerScore> playerScores)
        Determines the winner based on final scores. Breaks ties by character turn order.
        Parameters:
        playerScores - A map of players and their scores
        Returns:
        The player who wins the game

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame(java.lang.String filename)
        Saves the current game state to a JSON file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to save to

      • loadGame

        public void loadGame(java.lang.String filename)
        Loads a previously saved game from the specified file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to load the game from

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts a new game loop. Handles phases and round progression.
